activities.loc: Branch 2 Courtroom, 2nd Floor, Oneida County Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew L. Jordan

records.addlTxt:
2:02 PM Defendant Andrew L. Jordan in court. Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 22CF75, 22CF118, 22FO451 & 22FO452. Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Schiek states Information will be filed that mirrors Complaint. Defendant willing to proceed to Arraignment today; waives further reading and enters not guilty pleas. Defendant to make appointment with DA's office. Bond continued. adj. 02:06 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

3:14 PM Defendant Andrew L. Jordan in court.  Prosecuting attorney Mary M Sowinski Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Calling 22cf75,22cf118 and 22fo451,452.
Defendant has not obtained counsel.  Will proceed on own. Court reads on waiver of counsel. Waiver free and voluntary.
Court will set for preliminary hearing. Directs Def. to contact DA Schiek.
Bail continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

3:04 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Andrew L. Jordan in court. 
Calling 22cf75 and 22cf118, 22fo451,452.
Defendant has not yet obtained counsel- has been in contact with some attorneys. Court statement.
Bail continued.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

3:15 PM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Andrew L. Jordan in court. Calling 22CF75, 22CF118, 22FO451 & 22FO452. Defendant states Defendant is not eligible for PD or Court appointed counsel. Defendant will be obtaining counsel. Bond continued. adj. 03:17 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

2:46 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Andrew L. Jordan appeared by video, in custody. Calling 22CF75, 22CF118, 22FO451 & 22FO452. 22CF118 set for an initial appearance. In receipt of complaint, right to counsel. Schiek/Defendant statement to bail. Court sets bond. Court states Defendant not eligible for PD or Court appointed counsel. adj. 2:49 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
on Petition for Appointment of an Attorney - DENIED

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

Also calling 22fo451 and 452.
Defendant has not yet obtained counsel .  Not eligible for PD but has petition for COA.
Bail Continued
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

2:03 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Andrew L. Jordan appeared by video. Calling 22CF75, 22FO451 & 22FO452. In receipt of complaint, right to counsel. Schiek statement to bail. Court sets bond. adj. 02:06 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
